name: Italian Sociolinguistics
description: (Offered in English/Italian) A study of the current sociolinguistic situation of Italian. This course explores Italian dialects, regional variants, and the effect that immigration and emigration have had on the language as we read, hear, and speak it today. [36L]
prerequisites: Prerequisite for students enrolled in an Italian Minor, Major or Specialist program: ITA200Y5; all others LIN101H5/LIN102H5/FRE272H5.
